intro: Aneulophus congoensis, commonly known as the Congo spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in local remedies.
